summary: This is a Bureau of Prisons Health Services clinical encounter record for Jeffrey Epstein, documenting an injury assessment following an incident in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) on July 23, 2019. The report notes Epstein was found with a rope around his neck, shows marks consistent with ligature, and was placed on suicide watch, while Epstein himself claims not to know how the injury occurred.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: The inmate and subject of the medical encounter. He is assessed for neck injuries after being found in his cell with a rope around his neck, claims not to know how the injury happened, and is placed on suicide watch.

persons.name: MLP
persons.context: The medical provider (Mid-Level Practitioner) who conducted the clinical encounter, documented Epstein's vital signs, physical exam, and assessment, and recommended placement on suicide watch.

connections.description: MLP is the healthcare provider conducting the medical assessment and documenting the injury for inmate Epstein.

events.title: Epstein Cell Incident and Injury Assessment
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein is found in his cell in the Special Housing Unit with a rope around his neck, sitting on the floor. He is assessed by health services, shows a circular line of erythema (redness) around his neck, claims not to know how it happened, and is placed on suicide watch.

locations: Special Housing Unit Z05, Cell 124 L
keyFacts: On July 23, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell (Special Housing Unit Z05-Cell 124 L) at the MCC with a rope around his neck, sitting on the floor.

Epstein's medical assessment revealed a circular line of erythema (redness) at the base of his neck, approximately 2 inches wide, covering about two-thirds of the neck circumference, with signs of friction in the front.
Epstein repeatedly stated he did not know how the injury occurred, responding 'I do not know' and 'I don't know', and was unwilling to discuss the events leading to the marks.
Despite the injury, Epstein was documented as ambulatory, alert, oriented, smiling during the exam, and denying any pain, discomfort, or respiratory problems.
Based on the incident and assessment, Epstein was placed on suicide watch with a plan for follow-up by psychology services.
